meanings.definition: A person or business that sells goods in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The stockiest in town always has the best deals on bulk items.
meanings.sent2: The stockiest at the market had a wide variety of products to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The stockiest joked that they needed a bigger store to fit all their merchandise.
meanings.sent4: She was the stockiest of all the vendors, with shelves overflowing with goods.
meanings.sent5: The stockiest's warehouse was like a treasure trove of wholesale items.

meanings.definition: The largest or most complete collection of something.
meanings.sent1: Her bookshelf was the stockiest in the entire library.
meanings.sent2: The stockiest of antique coins was on display at the museum.
meanings.sent3: The stockiest of jokes made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The stockiest of memories flooded back as she looked through the photo album.
meanings.sent5: The stockiest of all the art pieces was a breathtaking masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The supply of goods available for sale in a store.
meanings.sent1: The stockiest on the shelves was running low after the big sale.
meanings.sent2: The stockiest of fresh produce was delivered to the grocery store early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The stockiest of snacks tempted customers at the checkout counter.
meanings.sent4: The stockiest of clothing options made it hard to choose just one outfit.
meanings.sent5: The stockiest of toys filled the store with colors and shapes.
